content.description: Detailed in Bob's best of book, it's the small right facing corner on the left side of the North Gully Wall. Some good jams and hidden jugs. Trend right on P2 in a nice corner, aiming for a tree on top.
content.location: Left side of North Gully Wall.

content.description: Fun finger crack, only 10a at the start, little dirty in spots but there's nice finger locks all over.
content.protection: Small to #2 BD. 2 raps to the ground (bolts) from tree to climbers left at the finish. Bolter anchor still there at 100' from the belay in the gully. Move right at the dead tree several feet on a ramp. Or you can finish the dirty crack another 30' and up to the tree rap.
content.location: North Gully, right side as descending. Directly across from finish of El Whampo. It's the curvy finger crack. Check out "Best Climbs" book by Bob Gaines.

content.description: Slab start to a belay then dive into the obvious, beautiful but dirty, right-leaning, right-facing second-pitch above.
content.location: Midway between the Mercy of the Sisters and the 10a, in the main tallest section of this north-facing, usually shady wall
